description: mounted on stiff paper; St. Jerome, with long curly white hair and long beard, crawling out of a cave; baskets in a lean-to to right of cave; lion in foreground, LRQ; lush landscape scene with large tree at left; inscription at bottom
inscription:
Signature, Date and Inscription

On lower margin below the scene: 
\"Roma relicta solus in sylius ago
Hic Roma tamen est et puellarum choris
\"Intersum Cremi cultor. Haud fugi satis
Urbem sequacem, Me cauerius inferam
\"Si forti Roma lus concidat cuaualis.\"

Translation:
Having abandoned Rome, I am alone in the forest. 
Yet Rome is here all the same, and a choir of girls. 
I am present as the tiller of ashes; by no means have I sufficiently
escaped the pursuing city: I bury myself in the cave, if by chance
Rome should perish.

On verso in pencil: \"Great St. Jerome Agostino Carracci/drawing on velum by Francesco Grigiotti dated 1623\" and \"063149\"
